document.discussion_title: Boy (13) critical in hospital after being struck by car while cycling his bike
document.topic_text: Irish Independent A 13-year-old boy is in a critical condition after being hit by a car near Drogheda last night The teen cyclist was rushed to Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital, Drogheda where is understood to be in a critical condition. It is understood the collision took place around the Drogheda-Slane road shortly after 8:30pm on Sunday night. The scene has been preserved – with the road around King William’s Glen Junction still closed off this morning. It is being examined by garda forensic collision investigators, with gardai not expecting the road to reopen until later on this morning at the earliest. Follow us
